page.title: 13The Burgs,Bayston Hill.
page.content: The Burgs is an Iron Age hill fort, lying on a ridge jutting North-East from the large village of Bayston Hill. The Northern ramparts of the Burgs are fairly flat because they are in a field and may have been ploughed up. You can just see the ditch.On their southern side they are very steep and there are two ditches. The oak trees crowd the fort growing up the southern slopes.The wildlife of the Burgs is mostly grass land,hedges and trees.The centre is a maze of tangled weeds like goose grass,nettles and brambles.The broom bushes grow in large clumps.The ash tree is very common inside the actual fort and the hawthorns were in full bloom when we were there.I think the Burgs is a beautiful and interesting place.It's like an unexplored island of mystery.
